website_summaries.verdict: This basic unit is a good buy for those who use a broadband ISP, and do not require a modem that can handle the speeds of a cable ISP.
pros: This unit is more compact than most Linksys modems, so it is a good option for those who need to save some space
Ideal for those who require just basic internet
cons: Not compatible with most cable ISPs

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: It has a faulty connection, no internet capability. I feel robbed! One of the photos is a technician with my ISP, letting me know that my internet connectivity problem is due to a faulty modem.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works great
customer_reviews.text: Used this modem for 8 years and it worked great. I've had very few problems with Linksys products.
customer_reviews.author: SJP

customer_reviews.title: Good in general, poor specific seller
customer_reviews.text: The product is great and definitely sturdy. The individual seller I got this from shipped it in a medium cardboard box with no padding, so I was shocked when I plugged it in and still worked. I only use basic Internet now because this delivers it reliably enough that I don't have to have absurdly fast internet.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Syrin

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Not until recently, I realized Comcast charged me $7.00 a month for its 7 year old Motorola modem, I have paid Comcast god knows how many year for that piece of crap. So I found this on Amazon, it seems to increase the bandwidth of my internet connection. Works very well, and very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great performance
customer_reviews.text: After getting tired of spending $$$ a month to rent a cable modem I bought the Linksys Etherfast. It's been stellar in every way. Setup was quick and simple with no glitches. Once installed, it has performaed reliably and and with all the speed you would expect from a cable modem. The lights on the front panel are simple and easy to read and it is very simple to operate. In summary, this is really a great cable modem and the price is very reasonable. It would be an excellent purchase for anyone ready to get broadband Internet access.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Boone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Linksys BEFCMU10 EhterFast Cable Modem and WRT54GS Wireless-G Broadband Router together. Received them this morning. Connecting and configuring went smoother than I have ever seen. Took about an hour, but most of that time was spent on the phone with my cable company to give them the new MAC adress of the modem. I have never seen my internet connection so fast. Setup was simple. Instructions were simple with graphics. I am totally pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J B Lesleh

customer_reviews.title: Best deal... SOOOO easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: My parents just joined the world of high-speed internet today, and I got them this brand of cable modem in order to save the leasing costs of one. Well, setting it up was a true breeze (like five minutes) and best of all, the price was unbeatable. I have absolutely no complaints about it and only nice things to praise it for. Way to go, Linksys! I am on my way to purchasing their wireless card to hook up with the wireless network in school.
customer_reviews.author: Manny H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sad about that
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work with Comcast. Comcast being Comcast, they refused to offer any support that would let this modem be compatible with their signal. Pretty sad about that.
customer_reviews.author: Constance

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in fine shape but ultimately, ineffectual
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in fine shape but did not work on any of my cable coaxial interfaces. I had purchased it to replace a Comcast modem I was renting but the "cable" LED never illuminated despite extensive troubleshooting. Oh well, it only cost $25 which is roughly the cost of a mid tier scotch!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: It worked from the start
customer_reviews.text: Amazon got the Linksys Cable modem to me, I returned the leased Toshiba Cable Modem to the local office, hooked up the Linksys, called up AT&T's @home broadband number, they took down the modem's details (model, serial number, MAC address), I power cycled everything, and it worked as it should. The only only other feature I would ask for is a programmable MAC address, so I could match it to the Toshiba address and avoid having to call AT&T. However, I am not willing to pay the extra ($$$)to bump up to the Xoom cable modem that has that feature.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity.
customer_reviews.text: This attractive cable modem utilizes the most popular DOCSIS protocol, and is therefore compatible with most systems (check /w your cable provider before ordering any cable modem). I particularly like the vertical setup (& stability), the easy-to-interpret LEDs, and the ethernet *and* USB connectivity. Of note, the Linksys products I've bought have always been trouble-free and their support reputation is good, just in case you were to have a problem. Lastly, prices are falling rather quickly since Linksys has entered the market, and this is right now the best buy around.
customer_reviews.author: Rheumor

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Great cable modem....called TWC and gave them the MAC address and we were up and running...I have a Linksys Wireless router also, all the Linksys products i have used have worked flawlessly and for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It works well, was easy to set up and I have had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Joe

customer_reviews.title: Hardware Version 4 will not work with Comcast in Colorado
customer_reviews.text: If you live in Colorado, don't buy this product. The latest version (4) will not work with Comcast in Colorado. Version 3 will work, but unfortunately, you can't find out the version number until you look at the bottom of the modem. Linksys should at least print the version number on the outside of the box. I had to return this modem and purchase a ZOOM 5241. It works perfectly (and its cheaper)!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Titera

customer_reviews.title: [company] is now shipping the BEFCMU10 version 2
customer_reviews.text: ...Setup on Cox couldn't have been easier. I called their technical support, gave them the MAC number and swapped out the old rental COM21. It came right up and my connection speed is 10% faster than the old COM21. Now I get the maximum speed for my level of service. Ignore [company]alternate photo showing the modem standing vertically, that's the old version 1 modem.[company]is shipping the version 2 which normally sets horizontal and is stackable with other Linksys products.
customer_reviews.author: VegasGuy

customer_reviews.title: No more no less than what you need
customer_reviews.text: No hassle, no "Go to Control Panel, Add/Remove hardware..." Nothing of that. This is a device intended to do what I was looking for: connect me to internet. The computer doesn't even know it is connected. What you need is your internet provider to know its brand and its serial number, so you can use their service with this modem. I get my service from Cox communications in Arizona and it has been working flawlessly for almost a month now. It was a great deal in Amazon for $[...] before a $[...] mail-in rebate which was quickly ackowledge by Linksys. Robust, fast, hassle free. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Piece, Perfect Price
customer_reviews.text: Had been debating on getting my own broadband modem since the cable company prices keep going up, but never decided to do it. Then I found this little modem, it matches my wireless router perfectly and for the price I decided it was time to get my "rental" costs back. Best decision ever!
customer_reviews.author: S. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and it's worked flawlessly ever since- I bought this to stack with my other linksys networking components and they all are made to index on each other- looks & works great. It seems as though linksys is changing some of it's designs and moving toward the universal small book form factor. That's too bad because the stackabable components are so much more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Modem works great, super easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: If you are deciding to buy your cable model, save yourself about $100 by buying this modem rather than one from your cable provider. I had Cox Cable's cable modem setup for Windows 98 and Windows 2000 for about a month (before and after the downfall of excite.com) and it worked just fine. I bought this modem, turned my computer off, unhooked the old modem, plugged this one in, powered on my computer and it worked perfectly! I couldn't have asked for an easier transition. (Plus it works great with my router/hub - which happens to be linksys as well.)
customer_reviews.author: Darian Wesolowski

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me - on Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Clearwire was too slow, so I opted to switch to Comcast, which was reputed to be the fastest service in Seattle. As I read in other reviews, and checking with the Comcast website, this modem works well with Comcast cable internet. I can't say anything else. Has not given me any problems since. My home wireless network is powered by, and the two products appear to work seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Richmond Asiodche

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine with AT&T Broadband/Comcast, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy 4-step process to install. I've had a leased modem for about a year and purchased this modem to save $3/month that I was being charged to lease the modem through AT&T. Only setup issue I had was that I am using a Linksys Wireless Access point DSL/Cable router and I needed to disconnect this for my cable company to setup my new modem for some reason. After they setup the new modem I hooked it back up to my Wireless router and everything works fine again.
customer_reviews.author: VQinside

customer_reviews.title: Buy to replace my Toshiba modem
customer_reviews.text: My ISP charges $5/month so I bought this item to replace their Toshiba modem. This Linksys model is recommended by them because of its compatibility. I personally like Linksys product too. So far there is no problem. I'd recommend to wait for promotion with mailing rebate or similar because it's quite expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Pikmin

customer_reviews.title: Another good Linksys product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem to replace an older (non-linksys) cable modem that had died. I was a little concerned about the version as I had read other reviews saying people had received ver. 2 or 3 from Amazon but I received a ver. 4 which (to the limit of my limited knowledge) is the most recent version. I had no problem getting it set up with Comcast and it has worked great so far. I have used a lot of Linksys products and have always been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Edminster

customer_reviews.title: Works great--speeds as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to arrive just before establishing my ATTBI service. Even though I signed on for basic installation only, the tech who came to set up the wiring also set the modem up (even though it's not included on the ATTBI basic installation). Speeds are as promised--a definite upgrade from dial-up service.
customer_reviews.author: M. DUNTON

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a long time, just became outdated and had to buy a newer model.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Keiffer

customer_reviews.title: for the cost of a month of modem rental i ...
customer_reviews.text: for the cost of a month of modem rental i can have my own. same speeds as the one from the cable companies.
customer_reviews.author: ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Cable Modem is a gem!
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely pleased with the Linksys BEFCMU10 cable modem. Linksys has managed to develop a standards-based cable modem that will work with any DOCSIS 1.0 cable ISP. AT&T Broadband is really supportive of 3rd party cable modems. I just plugged it in, plugged my computer in, and I was online! And this cable modem is FAST, too! The average consumer's experience with this product will depend highly on the support and speed of their ISP. This modem is top-notch, and a screamer! It has a 10/100Mbps Ethenet! If something goes wrong, it won't be with the cable modem. I would happily recommend this cable modem to anyone looking for a quality product that delivers performance and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Fredo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: I was one of those chumps who spent $4.00/ month for about 5 years through Comcast leasing a modem. When I switched to Cox (small market) I finally bought a modem. Since I have a complete Linksys wireless b-band home network this was the obvious choice. I have NO PROBLEMS WHATSOEVER with this modem. Once the modem was registered with the Cable provider it worked perfectly and has not failed me since.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya Biznis

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchase it. Save me ton of cash. I'm still using it. Never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: dsucces

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problems
customer_reviews.text: I rented my first cable modem from Comcast. Had to reset it constantly. Since I purchased and installed (very easy) the Linksys BEFCMU10 cable modem, I have had no problems going on 3 years. I won't mention the cable modem provided by Comcast but it was a well known company.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyJoe

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy install, super performance
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the reviews before I purchased this product. Wonder why some folks had problems -- installation was quick, easy and seamless (ofcourse, I was merely replacing the AT&T Broadband modem with mine). Transfer rates are great/as expected. Feels good to own it.
customer_reviews.author: Gautam Banerjea

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I just set up a home network, which is now working very fast with zero trouble. I use all Linksys produts, this Cable Modem, and Wireless-G Router with Speedboster and Wireless-G PC Adapter for my notebook computer. The set up of this Modem was easy, and I like the fact that I can stack up the router on top of the modem. Overall, I am happy with this network.
customer_reviews.author: Rockie Bear

customer_reviews.title: Good Modem.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first cable modem I have ever purchased, I used to just rent mine from the cable company. This is way better, it's way faster and way more stable then the old one's they gave us. Linksys makes good products and it's definately work the buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Napier

customer_reviews.title: Works great with cox.net
customer_reviews.text: I finally replaced the Motorola modem that I was renting from Cox for the past two years with this Linksys cable modem. Setup was easy and it was up and running right away after Cox (San Diego) changed their settings to match my new modem. Update: one year later and it's still going fine, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Garino

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to save the monthly charge of $5 from my local cable company, and because I was buying more bandwidth. Even before I got the extra bandwidth, there was a noticeable speed boost with this modem. It is a very efficient product. The great pricing thru Amazon made the deal even better! Can't go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: SkiMark

customer_reviews.title: okay for a bargain buy
customer_reviews.text: worked pretty well for a few years, then it let me down. got my money's worth out of it, so it's not a bad deal in a crunch.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: BE SURE MODEM WORKS WITH YOUR ISP!
customer_reviews.text: Check with your ISP (Mine's comcast) before purchasing! Their website should have a list of compatible modems! This one is not compatible with Cocast Colorado! I found out the hard way~
customer_reviews.author: Dangrenade

customer_reviews.title: fast
customer_reviews.text: Im a network tech and was hesitant to go to cable. I found that I couldn't go with DSL, so I bought this modem (and purchased cable service) and whamo...715K download\225K upload. This modem rocks and with ATTBI too. I also went with the Dlink router (the fairly [ok] one) and networked all 6 of my computers to the internet. this required additional equipment, however, since they were already networked via dialup, it was no problem. I give this modem a thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Fast Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I brought this cable modem because I had to get my own than rent cable modem from my apartment. I trusted Linksys brand for a long time and was very familiar with setup. This cable modem is the one you should get if you would like to own than rent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: been using for a number of years now - forgot to review it! Works great and easy to set up too
customer_reviews.author: M. Huck

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly the first time. Easy setup. Much faster than the vendor provided modem. No very bright lights so it can be placed in a bedroom without illuminating the entire room. It has the lowest heat production of all of the cable modems I've had. It runs very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Shatswell

customer_reviews.title: Easy hookup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, everything works fine. After about one month of use the only problem we have experienced is an occasional drop. We are using a Linksys router with the modem. Why the drop, not sure, turning everthing off and then back on hooks us back up.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C. Hargraves

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: It just keeps on ticking. I bought this 2 years ago to replace another band that went down after 9 months this one it still going strong and we stream a lot though it but is going good.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Item!
customer_reviews.text: This item is DOCSIS 1.1 but is still able to handle up to 30Mbit/s. I have been running 25Mbit down 3Mbit up with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mc

customer_reviews.title: It has been working well for some time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this long ago and it has worked well. I needed to cold reboot maybe three times in a year - and maybe not necessarily the fault of modem.
customer_reviews.author: Restuive

customer_reviews.title: Good shopping experience
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for excellent shopping experience. Modem is outdated for my ISP but it was in great shape. Decent shipping speed too!
customer_reviews.author: James W. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works great, connected immediately. This was a really good deal . Would recommend it to anyone looking for their on modem
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Totally Painless
customer_reviews.text: I got the BEFCMU10 for my father-in-law's win xp computer and it was totally painless to install and get working. It literally took 5 minutes including plugging in the cables.
customer_reviews.author: M. Crumpton

customer_reviews.title: What more could I want? It just plain works.
customer_reviews.text: I think my title says it all. "What more could I want? It just plain works." I had it in Phoenix, when I was on Cox Communications, and now that I'm in Albuquerque, it works on Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Aloysious

customer_reviews.title: Nothing wrong with the seller or the item. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the seller or the item. It just wasn't the right item for me. Not enough ethernet ports in the back.
customer_reviews.author: John Liotta

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Still On Top
customer_reviews.text: You still can't go wrong buying networking solutions from Linksys. The only time this modem can't find an internet signal is when my ISP has problems and stops sending it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D. Barker

customer_reviews.title: noot bad
customer_reviews.text: It created some problems first but i realised they were because of comcast not because of linksys. Overhoul good product but i have nothing to compare with. (this is my first cable modem:) I have been using it for 2 months and so far it works with its brother wireless router WRT54G perfectly. It might be cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: fox

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Get rid of your toshiba, motorola cable modems...
customer_reviews.text: Your cable is not going to assist you which cable modem is best. They come in , plug the appliance and bill. This appliance rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Edgard Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Cisco
customer_reviews.text: Cisco makes outstanding products. No denying that. I finally got a new pc ad this bad boy matched up pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: S. Choquette

customer_reviews.title: Linksys That Couldn't Link
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing, tried to install on my computer. After installing drivers, could not get unit to communicate with my IP. Used my IP Tech Support and Linksys Tech Support with no luck. Purchased Motorola Surfboard SB4200 and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: No hassles!
customer_reviews.text: Works just perfect. I use COX. I initially had problems setting up the modem and the connection. Only to discover later that the problem was with the cable company. They did not register my MAC address properly. So check to make sure that your cable company has the right MAC address and everything should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: SriniM

customer_reviews.title: High hopes, wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, called the cable company, couldn't get it to identify the incoming cable signal. Called Comcast, called Linksys. Both very helpful, both agreed it was a bad modem. Returned it (easy as always) got a new one, same exact sequence of events. Amazon rerfused to send me another on to try a third time. Can't give it a higher rating even though all othe linksys products have worked perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Soble

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good modem
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal Linksys customer, but I will try not to be too biased here. Overall, this modem is great, and it never fails. BUT it never fails IF you only do casual web surfing. Things starts to get ugly when Kazaa or BitTorrent or any P2P sharing program is running. I had to reset it every couple hours. This modem simply cannot take abnormally heavy duty load. So if you are just a regular web surfer, get this modem. And if you are doing a lot of P2P sharing, skip this modem.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: works great so far. believe it is the highest sold cable modem out there and has lived true to its name.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh HS

customer_reviews.title: Good product; Extremely easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: It took me only 10 minutes to call my ISP (Comcast) and get this cablemodem provisioned. It is that simple and easy. Some people said that Amazon.com was shipping version 1 of this product but the fact is that they are now shipping V2. I got mine as the one shown on the picture. I definitely recommend this product if you do not want to keep paying $5 to your ISPs forever!
customer_reviews.author: J. Tai

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: This modem was easy to set up and works great with my home computer system.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Easy install; durability still to be proven
customer_reviews.text: Easy, very easy to install. Just plug in, call the cable co to register and I was up and running. Replaced a Motorola SB5100 that was fried in an electrical storm. Seems to work great with the Linksys Wireless Router. We'll see how it holds up over a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: No Patience

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Linksys is just great stuff all around. Works great, sets up easy, does what it should END OF STORY... Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sacks

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: Used one works great no problems worth the price i just had to buy my own power supply but overall good
customer_reviews.author: tdizzel

customer_reviews.title: linksys
customer_reviews.text: a great product, which is what i've come to expect & get from linksy. thanx again
customer_reviews.author: ROSIE

customer_reviews.title: Easy even for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm running an OS10X Dual Core iMAC at home. Just plugged the modem in and it worked, nothing to change. Works great. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: E. Szymanski

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I plugged it in and it worked with no modifications to my software needed. What else can you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Roed

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented
customer_reviews.text: This modem was advertised as being COMCAST approved, there was NO model number listed in the ad, and it IS NOT on the COMCAST accepted list of modems, therefor a waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Homsher

customer_reviews.title: Good drop-in replacement for my old dead cable modem
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a drop-in replace for my Linksys cable modem and this is the most recent version of that it. It has worked without any issues since it started using it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Freeman

customer_reviews.title: works great with AT&T Broadband
customer_reviews.text: After frustrating results trying to set up the cable modem and 20 hours on line with @Home... no, not @Home. Today, ATTBI... (will it be ATTBI-Comcast???) The new ATTBI help desk officially does not support this modem. However, the reason for my troubles was because the flunkies that were helping me failed to properly register my MAC address. Be persistent with updating your MAC address with your cable ISP and the Linksys BEFCMU10 will work like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Worked well a little slow sending
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys is flawless and preforms very well improving my throughout
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: It works well with comcast cable
customer_reviews.text: Just follow the manual step by step. The mac address can not be added automatically, you need to call comcast to add it in.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Zeng

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The unit was exactly what I expected and needed. I was replacing a RCA rental provided by Comcast. It took longer to get Comcast to add it then it did to install. Included CAT 5 and USB cables for connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Just the right amount of tech.
customer_reviews.text: Router arrived very promptly, was the correct revision number, works perfectly. Nine more words because I can't stand to ramble.
customer_reviews.author: SubIgnition

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Followed the instructions and it just worked. Would recommend to anyone (including my friends).
customer_reviews.author: Laura Fink

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I've had this "cable modem" installed for 6 months now and never had a problem. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: All computer hardware should be this easy...
customer_reviews.text: Truly a snap to install on my Windows ME system...and it works great. The most difficult part was getting my provider to change the MAC ID. Highly recommend this cable modem (...)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Amazon Shopper
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with Amazon for listing this product and selling it to me without advising me that there was at least two more recent versions of the product. Amazon shipped me version 2 of this modem which is not even supported anymore. It was my cable company who alerted me to the fact that I was screwed by Amazon, and that there is a version 3 and a version 4 available. No where in the information provided by Amazon did they reveal the fact that there were other versions of this product. I'll have to think hard and long before purchasing anything from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: KMB Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Comcast no longer connects these
customer_reviews.text: It was not that I didn't like it, but Comcast no longer would acknowledge the product for me and so it was of no value and I had to return it, but I was given complete credit for the product by the seller and was no fault his, that it no longer was excepted by Comcast!
customer_reviews.author: zmsffir

customer_reviews.title: Lynksys Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Lynksys, A brand name I always trust for quality. The one I ordered was defective, But don't fret thats a rare for this company. Linksys has been int the networking business for a long time now and I will continue to buy their products, and I think you should to.
customer_reviews.author: W. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a DOCSIS-3 Cable Modem that was advertised as having that capability but received an older modem, one that did not have DOCSIS-3. Comcast requires the DOCSIS-3 Cable Modem for their cable internet access. The cable modem features listed that it had the DOCSIS-3 upgrade but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: gator_guy57

customer_reviews.title: Setup difficult
customer_reviews.text: The modem works well but was very hard to set up. Much harder than an Apple Airport that I had setup previously
customer_reviews.author: De_Dicto

customer_reviews.title: linksys
customer_reviews.text: product was well maintained and in great condition i just wish i had know it didnt come with any of the essential wires
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M. Green

customer_reviews.title: BEFCMU10 not so hot
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem drops its connection far too frequently. This happened rarely with the cable modem that I previously used (on lease) from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: WillB

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT I WANTED
customer_reviews.text: I didn't order the right thing. I didn't realize that I needed a DSL and this isn't a DSL so I plant to drop it off at Good Will.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia R. Franklin

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys BEFCMU10 Ethernet Cable Modem
product_meta.description:
If you’re tired of the slow & frustrating performance of 56k modems & dial-up Internet providers, then your salvation is here in the form of the Linksys BEFCMU10 EtherFast Cable Modem. With a cable modem you are always connected to the Internet & you will experience speeds many times that of standard 56k modems. And it’s easy to use. Just plug the plug-and-play device into any USB port on your PC. You can even plug it into your Ethernet port or an optional Linksys Router for easy Internet sharing through the home.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Are you ready to step up to high-speed broadband Internet? The EtherFast cable modem with USB and Ethernet connection from Linksys provides you with the perfect solution for a fast and easy Internet connection. 

 Now you can make the most of the Internet and cruise the Web at speeds you never imagined possible. Cable-modem Internet service means no more waiting for lagging downloads--even the most graphic-intensive Web pages load in seconds. 

 And if you're looking for convenience and affordability, the EtherFast cable modem with USB really delivers. Installation is quick and easy. The plug-and-play EtherFast cable modem with USB connects directly to any USB-ready PC--just plug it in and you're ready to surf the Internet. Or connect it to your LAN using a router and share that speed with everyone on your network. 

 So if you're ready to enjoy broadband Internet speed, then you're ready for the EtherFast cable modem with USB and Ethernet connection from Linksys. It's the easiest and most affordable way to harness the full potential of the Internet. 

 Features: 

 * Easy installation--one phone call to your Internet service provider completes the setup 
 * "Always on" connection eliminates worries about busy signals and time-outs 
 * Much faster downloads and uploads than dial-up Internet connections 
 * Seamlessly compatible with Linksys routers
feature_bullets: Fully compatible with Linksys routers to connect multiple computers to broadband internet
Up to 42 Mbps download speeds, 10 Mbps upload
"Always On" connection; no more busy signals or timeouts
Up to 42 Mbps download speeds, 10 Mbps upload
"Always On" connection; no more busy signals or timeouts
Fully compatible with Linksys routers to connect multiple computers to broadband internet
